text: Stefanie Zweig (19 September 1932 - 25 April 2014) was a German writer. She was best known for her autobiographical novel, Nirgendwo in Afrika (Nowhere in Africa, 1998), based on her early life in Kenya. The novel was made into a movie and won an Academy Award in 2002 for Best Foreign Language Film. Zweig was born in Leobsch√ºtz, Upper Silesia (now Poland). Her family was Jewish and fled Nazi Germany to Kenya. Zweig died after a short illness on 25 April 2014 in Frankfurt, Hesse, Germany.
